How It Works? Start by creating a case for the patient. For each case, you can have multiple interactions (or consultations) with the patient (clinic, video, chat, call etc.). E.g. you can think of one clinic appointment as one interaction (or consultation) and a phone call as another interaction. Save records and create prescriptions for any interaction you have with the patient. If a particular case is closed, you can create a new case for the patient where appropriate. Step 1. Enter Case Name Step 2. Create Interaction Don\'t show again Proceed To Add Records Proceed To Create Notes Create New Interaction Case: Interaction Exit Adding Notes Select which type of record you want to add Upload HandWritten Notes Log Evaluation Records Log Treatment Plan Share Prescription Save Prescription Getting Started No patient found in the name of All Category Searching.Please wait... Please search for the patient you want to book an appointment for To Book an Appt. you need to add a patient Add First Patient Setup Practice Add/Configure Services like Video,Clinic or Chat for Consultation Profile Setup your Personal & Professional identity Staff Have People to help? Set your Reminders, Records Preferences Preferences Search for patient by name or number Id/Name/Ph-Number

Search for a patient by name or number.\n OR \n 2. Add a new patient by clicking the button below. Articles Video Details Title (Mandatory) Description (Mandatory) Language Select language NEXT Video URL (Mandatory) CREATE Text articles Content (mandatory) Image article Add Image Send Message Write message here Consulted Patients Only All Registered Users This message will be instantly sent as a notification (NOT SMS) to your consulted patients who have downloaded your mobile app successful settlement is the amount which transferred successfully into your account by payU. If patient complete the payment process through online then the payment status will be Received If patient has not done the payment yet for the current consultation, the payment status will be pending. Usually this happens when the payment is offline for clinic consultation If patient complete the payment process through online then the payment status will be Received Payment Received Successfully This Indicates that the amount has not been credited to your account due to certain reasons-\n 1.You need to complete KYC verification on PayU portal as you have reached 10K limit.\n 2.Your payment is still under process This Indicates that the amount has been successfully credited to your account via PayU. This indicates that the refund amount has been successfully credited to the patients account This indicates that the refund amount has not yet been Transferred and is being processed This indicates that the refund has been initiated. You can override the Request to cancel the refund Do you want to create invoice? Payment Status has been updated. //merchant gateway verify To enable digital payment collections from patients, You need to create/activate your PayUMoney account. Bank verification failed from PayU system.
//merchant gateway setup from To enable digital payment collections from patients, You need to create/activate your PayUMoney account.\nSteps to activate your PayU account: \nTo enable online payment collections on your WhiteCoats application, Please take 10 minutes and complete PayU account activation.\n1. Log into your dashboard with your registered email ID and number or via OTP received on your registered mobile number.\n2. Verify your bank account and start collecting payments instantly.This short video will show you how to verify your bank account in 2 minutes.\n3. Once you have completed Bank verification,please enter your website and application URL(you would have received this in an email from the WC team).\n4. Complete the requested document upload and e-sign to activate your account. To accept online payments from patients and receive them directly to your bank account in a safe and secure manner, a merchant account is needed.\nWhiteCoats has tied up with PayU - one of India\'s largest payment services provider - to empower doctors to collect online payments from patients directly and safely.
Create PayU Merchant Account Connect Existing Account I already have a PayU merchant account
Create payU Merchant Update Details Update Bank Details Edit Merchant Details Update Bank Details //create new account Create PayU Account Create your PayUmoney account by submitting the following details. Step 1 of 2:Merchant Details Step 2 of 2:Bank Details Enter OTP* Merchant Name* Merchant Email* Merchant Phone* Bank Account No.* Monthly Expected Amount* Re-enter Bank Account No.* Bank Account IFSC Code* Bank Account Holder Name* PAN Number (for practice):* Name on PAN Card:* Address* Pin Code* Practice Name (as per PAN card)* Registration Type For Practice* Business Category* Business SubCategory* Business URL* Android URL*
Eg: 152488 OTP Expires in 15:00 MINUTES Enter Merchant Name Enter Merchant Email Enter Merchant Phone E.g: 3445238723 E.g: 40000 Re-enter Bank Account No. Enter Bank Account IFSC Code* E.g: Mark Boe E.g: Mark Boe E.g: Building Name.,Street Name Enter Pin Code E.g: Mark Boe E.g: BMFPE3445D Enter Business Registered Name Enter Business URL Enter Android URL
//Existing account Connect Existing Account Please login to your PayUmoney account here to get this info. Click here to know where you can find your MID,Salt, and key. How to Connect the PayU Account 1.Please login to your PayUmoney account\n2.Go to Setting and find your MID,Salt, and key.\n3.Enter your details below in the form and click Connect Account button To get any help regarding this, please click here. You can also email at whitecoats.support@payu.in Merchant MID* Merchant Key* Merchant Salt* Enter Merchant MID Enter Merchant key Enter Merchant Salt Connect Account Save & Next Step Connecting Status To get any help regarding this,please click here. You can also email at whitecoats.support@payu.in Dont refresh/close the app without submitting the form. You will have to re-enter the form again
//penny amount Enter Penny Amount Please enter the amount you received into your bank A/C No.. We have sent OTP on your mobile number OTP Expires in 30:00 min Note:After OTP, PayU system will deposit a small amount into your bank account and you will have to enter it in the next step. Enter Amount* Enter OTP* Verify Submit Penny Verification Verify Manually Now Upload KYC Document Additional verification required to complete bank verification. Unfortunately,your verification attempts have been exhausted You can complete your bank account verification manually by following the steps below. 1. An OTP will be sent to your mobile number. Please enter it for verification.\n2. You would have received a small amount in the bank account you had provided. Please enter the value of that amount.\nIf the above two details match, the bank account will be verified instantly, and you may start receiving online payments from patients immediately. If not, you may repeat the steps above OR change the bank account Retry Penny Verification //bank verify in progress Your bank verification is in progress: Please check your status again at to proceed further //bank failed Your bank account could not be verified. This could be because of an issue with the account details or with the payment systems. Kindly update your bank account and try again. Kindly contact us if you need further assistance.
//update merchant After submitting the bank details, system will auto verify the bank details using the API, which will take 15 mins of time Merchant Account Status Additional Verification Required Verification Attempts Exhausted Bank Verification Successful To Complete KYC click here. This will allow you to receive settlements into your bank account. Bank Verification Failed Bank Verification In Progress Verification Successful Account Status Account Created Pan Status Merchant Details Bank Details Change Bank Details Change PAN/Merchant Details Practice Information Verify Manually Now Bank Verification Status Unfortunately your Bank Verification Failed.To complete the verification you can do it by doing Penny Verification
Update Merchant Details //Bank verification Bank verification is successful.\nTo complete merchant account creation, tap on the link and complete KYC process with PayU. Why Upload KYC?\nWhen bank verification is complete,but KYC is pending, user will receive settlement only upto \u20B910000 Beyond \u20B910000, patients can still book appointment by making payments but, user will not receive settlement. //bank details statement To change your bank account, For security reasons you need to first enter the OTP sent to your mobile number //pan details statement To change your pan details, For security reasons you need to first enter the OTP sent to your mobile number //save & proceed text The above details will form your merchant identity with PayU.\nFor most doctors, this would be their own name, email and mobile. If your practice is a separate legal entity (e.g. partnership, private limited etc.) , you may want this to be the name of your registered business, registered email and mobile.
//Bank verification success Bank verification is successful. You can now start receiving payments from your patients directly.\nYou will start receiving money into your bank account upto INR 10,000/- only, until you complete KYC. Click here to go to PayU Portal Once your cumulative/total patient payments go above INR 10,000/, for compliance reasons as per regulations,\nyou will need to provide additional documents as per the nature of your business and sign a standard agreement with PayU.When agreement is not signed, upto ₹10,000, amount will be settled to Bank. When it exceeds ₹10,000, upto ₹50,000 will be held in account until KYC and agreement sign is done. Also note, your patients will not be able to do any transactions once your cumulative/total patient payments reach ₹50,000 unless you complete KYC. For most doctors, this may simply be providing a photocopy of Aadhaar and Pan Card. However, if your practice is a more sophisticated registered legal entity (e.g. a private limited, partnership etc.), you may be required to submit additional documents as determined by PayUs compliance needs Note: This step is mandatory once you cross INR 10,000 in cumulative online payments. Failing to do so means you will stop receiving payments from your patients with immediate effect. Complete KYC //penny dialog title Penny Verification
//bank details Bank Holder Name* Re-enter Bank Account No* Note: You may be required to undergo additional verification. If the bank account holder name does not match the merchant name. //set up Why do I need to have a PayU merchant account? Steps to activate your PayU account: There are two types of PayU account activation.\nType 1. Without KYC\nThis takes less than 5 minutes and allows you to immediately start collecting payments upto INR 10,000 (cumulative).\n1. Choose your merchant account holder details.\n2. Enter your practice details (Pan, business type etc.) AND bank account details.\n3. Your details will be sent to PayU for auto-verification. If successful, you may immediately start receiving payments in your bank account upto a total of INR 10,000/- (cumulatively). If auto-verification is unsuccessful, you may be asked to either verify your bank account or provide additional documents.\nType 2. With KYC Once your cumulative/total patient payments go above INR 10,000/-, for compliance reasons as per regulations, you will need to provide additional documents as per the nature of your business and sign a standard agreement with PayU.\nFor most doctors, this may simply be providing a photocopy of Aadhaar and Pan Card. However, if your practice is a more sophisticated registered legal entity (e.g. a private limited, partnership etc.), you may be required to submit additional documentsas determined by PayU\'s compliance needs Note: This step is mandatory once you cross INR 10,000 in cumulative online payments. Failing to do so means you will stop receiving payments from your patients with immediate effect. (Monday to Friday-10am to 7pm)
Thank you Your details have been submitted successfully to PayU. We will initiate you via email once PayU completes its auto verification attempt. This is usually takes 30 minutes. Alternatively, please check back the status in 2 Hours to know the status.
//payU support dialog Access your merchant details,view detailed payment history,complete your KYC process or get any other help. Access PayU Account
//exhausted dialog Thank you for reaching out to us. You will receive a call back from our team within 48hrs.

Dictate Prescription Start Dictating Pause Dictation Start Testing Mic Clear All Dictations Save Records Stop Dictation
1. Press the start button to activate the voice capturing mic. Please ensure you give the mic permission to record your voice. \n\n 2. Please be very clear of what you say so that the AI can catch your word correctly. It will be best if you will dictate close to the mic. \n\n3. When you dictate and the AI fails to understand the word, try talking slowly to see if it understand what you say. \n\n4. There might be many cases where the AI will not recognise certain word as they may not be in our database. In such case please enter it manually for now as we will update the database with those new words. \n\n5. You can easily Pause and Resume Dictation in between. \n\n6. When you dictate you can see the text feedback in "Your Dictation" Section. \n\n7. There are different sections to help you understand what you can dictate and record the data. \n\n8. Once done you can stop the dictation and review the output. We also give edit option for you to correct the mistake happened during the dictation.
1. Patient <vital> is <value> eg. "patient bp is 120 by 80" \n2. Take <medicine-name> [frequency] [for N days] [directions] [after | before food] eg. "take Meftal tablet SOS for 7 days after food", "take Crocin twice daily" \n3. Go for <testnames> after N days eg. "go for CBC, blood sugar", "go for MRI after 3 days" \n4. <testname> is positive (or a numeric value) eg. "blood sugar is 140", "malarial parasite test is positive" \n5. Patient complains of <symptoms> [from ...] eg. Patient complains of body pain from past 3 days \n6. She has history of <symptoms> [from last ..] eg. patient has history of headache from last 3 years \n7.Patient has family history of <symptoms> eg. he has family history of diabetes, hypertension \n8. Patient <habit> [since …] eg. Patient is smoking since last 10 years. \n9. He/she has <symptoms> eg. "she has rashes, fever and headache" \n10. He has <allergy-type> allergy from <allergen> causing <symptom> eg. he has food allergy from peanuts causing skin rashes \n11. He/she is diagnosed with <disease-name> eg. "she is diagnosed with diabetes type two" \n12. You can see me after N days or Follow up after N days (follow up) eg. "follow up after 1 month" \n13. SIMBO NOTE ... <dictate notes< …. SIMBO EXIT (or any other Simbo command - to exit note-taking mode) \n14. SIMBO <section> NOTE …. eg. Simbo medical-history note \n15. SIMBO <section> [item|number] # NOTE … eg. Simbo medicine item 3 note ...
Press [img src=ok16/] to accept or [img src=retry16/] to retry

Thank you for reaching out. one of our client success partners will reach out to you shortly to help you. If you can\’t wait to get going, please feel free to use the live chat option between Monday to Friday 10 am to 7 pm.

Save & Close Save & Add More Update Record Removing the record How it works? Please select a medicine from the drop down list or add to database Enter your UPI id to enable patient do online payment to you. Please make sure you enter your correct UPI Id for smooth payment. Provide a staff contact number so that your patient can contact them and confirm the appointment via UPI payment. All the payment will be collected offline for all your services. You can manually change the payment status in appointment list once the patient pays you. You can input your own Payment Merchant Account. You can get all the information on your payment console.
